name: DriveCam Event
summary: Learn about .DCE files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: DriveCam is a dashboard camera that, in addition to recording footage while a driver is driving, notifies the driver when they are engaging in distracted driving. Typically, DriveCam begins recording when it notices:
A sudden change in vehicle motion
A driver performing a risky driving activity (such as using their cell phone)
Users can also manually start a DriveCam recording or set the device to record continuously.

The recordings that DriveCam creates are saved as DCE files. Each DCE file contains two separate videos: one of the vehicle's interior and one of the exterior environment. Users can view both recordings by opening the DCE file with DriveCam Event Player.

instructions:
If you have a DCE file from a DriveCam system, you might need specialized software or tools provided by the manufacturer to view and analyze the video content; the specific details about the DCE file format and compatibility can vary depending on the manufacturer and model of the DriveCam system.

You can also convert the DCE file to AVI format and then use AVI player to play the video.
You can open a DCE file with Lytx DriveCam Event Player. However, DriveCam Event Player is now discontinued. Current DriveCam users can access their DriveCam videos from within their Lytx account.
If you still have access to DriveCam Event Player, you can use it to convert DCE files to the .AVI (Audio Video Interleave) format.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
